stepAnswer: Emission spectroscopy measures light emitted by a sample, while absorption spectroscopy measures light absorbed by a sample
stepTitle: What is the main difference between emission and absorption spectroscopy?
choices: Emission spectroscopy measures light emitted by a sample, while absorption spectroscopy measures light absorbed by a sample
Emission spectroscopy measures light absorbed by a sample, while absorption spectroscopy measures light emitted by a sample
Both techniques measure light absorbed by a sample
Both techniques measure light emitted by a sample
